image.altText: Side view of woman throwing a baby into the air but baby shape is cut out and blank

props.synopsis: Elon Musk believes the collapsing birth rate is humanity's biggest danger. But antinatalists argue having kids is little more than a procreational Ponzi scheme, and the risks are real.

title.children: The confronting climate change disrupter you probably didn't think of

image.altText: Woman staring off to the side of the camera.

props.synopsis: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

title.children: Former nurse 'extremely angry' after cancer deemed inoperable

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up, with Chris Bowen in background.

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese touches down in New York ahead of the UN General Assembly, Republicans issue a warning against formally recognising Palestinian statehood.

title.children: Republicans warn PM of 'punitive measures' over Palestinian recognition

image.altText: Man at the beach looks off into the distance. There is a jetty behind him.

props.synopsis: Experts are calling for new regulations on artificial intelligence chatbots, after a triple j hack investigation uncovered a disturbing example of a chatbot encouraging a man to murder his father while engaging in paedophilic role-play.

title.children: Australian man encouraged to murder his father by AI chatbot

image.altText: A man uses a smartphone as travellers queue to check in at Heathrow Airport Terminal 4

props.synopsis: The attack on a provider of check-in and boarding systems causes mass disruption at several major European airports, including London's Heathrow.

title.children: Cyber attack causes mass disruption at major European airports

image.altText: Donald Trump stands beneath a US flag billowing in a breeze

props.synopsis: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.

title.children: Republicans divided in free speech quagmire after Charlie Kirk's death

image.altText: A woman uses her phone outside an Optus store as a man looks at his.

props.synopsis: Optus reveals it received an early warning of Thursday's system failure — which has since been linked to a fourth death — hours before the situation was fixed, but that it did not respond appropriately to complaints from concerned customers.

title.children: Optus admits early warning about triple-0 failure as fourth death investigated

image.altText: Man wearing Nepal Police flak jacket has mouth wide open and long hair flying carrying a shield in one hand

props.synopsis: These movements may be separated by time, distance and language, but they were all born on social media, led by a new generation of activists fed up with the old systems of corruption and nepotism.

title.children: Social media is a double-edged sword in protests against corruption and nepotism

image.altText: man smiling

props.synopsis: Court documents allege a 53-year-old Queensland man ran a fake whale euthanasia charity to traffic assisted suicide drugs.

title.children: How whale charity operator alleged ran a body 'discovery service'

image.altText: A smiling Brisbane Lions player Lachie Neale (not in playing gear) shakes hands with a fan in the rooms after a win.

props.synopsis: A training session on Saturday morning featuring speed work adds to Lachie Neale's optimism about returning for Brisbane in the AFL grand final after the Lions beat the Magpies.

title.children: 'Hopefully Fages picks me': Neale talks up grand final chances after solid training

image.altText: A dejected Canberra NRL coach puts his hand over his face and his captain looks down at a press conference.

props.synopsis: An out-of-place nose doesn't hurt Joe Tapine as much as Canberra's NRL finals exit, but he hopes the pain of defeat will drive them to greater things next year.

title.children: Raiders rue lost opportunity as minor premiers make early exit

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair swept in a French twist smiles in warm lighting

props.synopsis: Away from the public eye, Katharine, the Duchess of Kent, was a trailblazer quietly changing lives.

title.children: This royal had a big secret and others benefited from it

image.altText: A man and woman pose at entry to a train tunnel in China

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan has completed a tour of five Chinese cities where she has attempted to set the tone for future trade, boost Chinese international student numbers and promote her Suburban Rail Loop project.

title.children: Premier Jacinta Allan has just been to China. What did her trip achieve?

image.altText: A woman smiles for a photo while holding a large bouquet of orange flowers and baby's breath

props.synopsis: A Pakistani court charges a 22-year-old man with murder for shooting a teenage social media influencer, Sana Yousaf, after refusing his offer of friendship.

title.children: Man formally charged with murdering Pakistani TikTok influencer

image.altText: 一群人在一个展厅中

props.synopsis: Beijing's decision this week to ban Chinese companies from using microchips made by US firm Nvidia indicates the country is increasingly confident about replacing them with domestically produced chips, experts say.

title.children: What Beijing's ban on Nvidia chips says about the AI race

image.altText: A jetty overlooking water and a boat in distance.

props.synopsis: Piracy and sea robberies are increasing in the strategic straits of Malacca and Singapore, which could have implications for Australian imports and exports.

title.children: Australia's shipping industry on alert as pirate attacks escalate

image.altText: Mackenzie Little looks at a medal

props.synopsis: Mackenzie Little's second successive World Athletics Championships bronze medal is an amazing achievement, all the more so considering she's a full-time surgical resident.

title.children: Javelin bronze the 'icing on the cake' for Dr Little

image.altText: NT Police car flashing lights

props.synopsis: Police say initial investigations indicate a silver Jeep was parked on the side of the northbound M1, near the Smith Street on ramp, when it was struck by a grey utility.

title.children: Baby dies after ute hits Jeep on the Gold Coast

image.altText: A man with his arm around the shoulder of a woman

props.synopsis: Couples that were due to marry at the Loxley on Bellbird Hill wedding venue in the Hawkesbury feel they have been left in limbo following a devastating fire.

title.children: Hopeful newlyweds fear debt and anxiety after wedding venue fire

image.altText: a young aboriginal child with palms covered in red dustry ochre

props.synopsis: If you're overwhelmed by emissions targets, climate change and environmental collapse, start small and look to First Nations practices to help your wellbeing and the world around you.

title.children: Feeling stifled by climate change grief? Try practising the 'three Ls'

image.altText: Generic Drone of Homes

props.synopsis: The ACT government has passed legislation enshrining housing as a human right. What does that mean, and should other states follow?

title.children: Solving the housing crisis is a marathon but a new law could be the first step

image.altText: A female tennis player in white with racket stands beside her mother in grey.

props.synopsis: Cara Korhonen played on Rod Laver Arena when she was 10 years of age and is putting her blood, sweat and tears into setting foot on there again.

title.children: Tennis dreams come at a cost as you lose money even when you win

image.altText: Donald Trump holds up a signed executive order with a smile on his face, while sitting in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: Some hope this visa price hike will see the US tech industry prioritise American workers. Others argue it'll dissuade the "world's smartest talent" from choosing to work in the US.

title.children: Trump will impose a $150,000 annual fee for H-1B visas. Here's what it means

image.altText: Frank Pangello in blue tshirt and cap stands next to Vincent Tarzia at a political media conference.

props.synopsis: When Frank Pangallo announced he was joining the Liberal party, he vowed to put the blowtorch on a first-term government riding high in the polls. But barely four weeks later, the blowtorch is firmly on Pangallo instead, writes Leah MacLennan.

title.children: AI 'admin error' puts SA Liberals' star recruit in spotlight

image.altText: Cars on fire at the site of a residential building damaged during a Russian drone strike

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president says he will hold "a meeting with the President of the United States" to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine and sanctions on Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy to meet Trump at UN General Assembly as Russian attacks intensify

image.altText: Bundles of Australian bank notes, mostly in 50 dollar denominations, in clear plastic bags.

props.synopsis: Police say they were conducting a random breath test when they came across the cardboard box full of cash.

title.children: Tasmanian man charged after police find $1 million in his vehicle

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: I like your trivia enthusiasm, but be careful — you're about to taste defeat.

title.children: Alright Brainiac, I've seen your type before. It's time to play … HARD!

image.altText: A young boy in a wheelchair looking at an electonic tablet in a waiting room.

props.synopsis: Chronic pain has devastating effects on those who suffer from it, including children, but it has wider impacts and they are costing Australia billions, a survey has found.

title.children: How a playground injury changed a family's entire life

image.altText: Two girls wearing helmets and a man sit on the edge of a quarter pipe at the skate park with a skateboard on their laps.

props.synopsis: For almost eight years, Jay MacAskill's skateboard was collecting dust at home — until his daughter found the skate park around the corner.

title.children: Four-year-old tearing up the skate park with dad, sister in tow

image.altText: Oscar Piastri crashes in qualifying, Azerbaijan Grand Prix

props.synopsis: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri crashed out of qualifying in Azerbaijan, but his teammate and championship rival Lando Norris was unable to make the Australian pay.

title.children: Oscar Piastri crashes out of F1 qualifying, Norris fails to capitalise

image.altText: Anne Hatchard of the Crows gathers the ball.

props.synopsis: The AFLW's rapid evolution has been a double-edged sword for Adelaide, which is the most successful club in competition history, having won three of the eight premierships.

title.children: Powerhouse AFLW side being challenged as comp evolves

image.altText: Peter holds his grey poodle Maggie in front of the river.

props.synopsis: "Pensioner Pete" Dixon is paddling the 2,400-kilometre length of the Murray River with his poodle as a tribute to his late wife, raising money for cancer treatment in the process.

title.children: 'Pensioner Pete' paddles the Murray with a poodle, for love and money

image.altText: A Canadian rugby union player runs the ball toward the line as a New Zealand player tries to stop her.

props.synopsis: A changing of the guard in women's rugby union as two-time defending world champions New Zealand is beaten for the first time at the tournament since 2014 by a brilliant Canadian side.

title.children: Canada dazzles to end New Zealand's Women's Rugby World Cup dominance

image.altText: Woman with red hair, lips and nails, holding pink sunglasses and wearing a navy polka-dot dress.

props.synopsis: Women are embracing modern pin-up culture as a way to express confidence and joy in their own skin.

title.children: Pin-up is for everyone 'no matter your age, size or shape'

image.altText: A woman and two men in medical scrubs pose in a hospital

props.synopsis: In a sea of hospital-based TV, long-running sitcoms Scrubs is often highlighted as one of the most realistic options. Now the reboot has been confirmed, and off the back of The Pitt’s big Emmy wins, we look back at the beloved show.

title.children: Scrubs is getting a reboot just in time for the hospital procedural revival
